title: AR and VR for Engagement in planning

members.title: Virtual Reality in Planning
members.abstract: students used VR to engage with a local community on the design of their area
members.details: This was a student research project at Cal Poly that explored how VR could be used in the planning process. Working with the city of GilRoy they developed four plans for commerical spaces. The scenarios they developed could be compared on VR headsets. They used a number of different software applications including SketchUp,  City Engine, ArcGIS, Spatial and vSpatial

members.title: An augmented reality study for public participation in urban planning
members.abstract: Research that looks at how useful AR is for public particpation

members.title: Newquay Futures
members.abstract: A virtual bike ride around Newquay looking at possible future developments
members.details: The council working with local organisations created the VR experience through PropTech government funding. People can take a virtual tour of the town inside a VR headset, seeing proposed developments. They can then give comments
